title: At Hand Tuner Pro: Wear+Strobe
summary: A fast, precise chromatic and strobe tuner for Android and Wear.
description: A Real Strobe Tuner on your Wrist!For musicians who wish to tune their instruments with the device that is always with them on their wrist (or in their pocket), @HandTuner is a Responsive, Precise Chromatic tuner with a beautiful, intuitive interface that can tune guitar, ukelele, cello, piano, harmonium, bagpipes, harp, violin, your voice, and whatever other instrument you can throw at it!  Reviews:http://www.androidpolice.com/2015/01/28/athandtuner-wearable-instrument-tuner-wear-watch-works-really-well/http://www.ubergizmo.com/2015/01/athandtuner-is-a-guitar-tuner-for-your-android-wear-device/http://www.androidheadlines.com/2015/01/athandtuner-puts-guitar-tuner-android-wear-smartwatch.htmlhttps://disqus.com/home/discussion/androidpolice/athandtuner_is_a_wearable_instrument_tuner_for_your_wear_watch_and_it_works_really_well/http://phoneia.com/you-can-now-tune-your-guitar-using-android-wear-with-athandtuner/Once purchased, a chromatic tuner will be installed on your mobile, and an additional smartwatch tuner will be installed on your Android Wear watch (if you have one).   You do NOT need a wear device to run the tuner, though, although the current simple and intuitive interface is perfect for wearable devices!Features:- 8kHz, 44.1kHz, or f8kHz sample rate- Wide frequency range- Precise & Responsive- Transposition- Selection of Notation- Selection of colors- Synchronization from mobile device to wearable (so you don't have to mess around with the tiny screen on the wearable.)- "Clip-on" tuner mode, where the screen on the watch can be rotated, and the watch "clipped on" to the guitar."- 3-Harmonic strobe tuner.- Two drawing modes: "Arc" and "Trace."  Trace mode uses blur effects to show where you've been and where you're going.- Synchronization to wear device from mobile device.Works on all of the Wear Devices that we have tested so far, including LG G-Watch, LG G-Watch R, Motorola 360.  If you have problems with your own wearable, please let us know!Limited to devices running 4.0.1 and up because of the integration with Android Wear.If you have problems, please let us know so we can fix them!If you want to help us develop features and join our community, join us at atHandTuner Beta on Google+:https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/106950377968435927230And then follow the link from there back to here to opt-into the beta version!Best Regards, Acorn Technology
descriptionHTML:
A Real Strobe Tuner on your Wrist!

For musicians who wish to tune their instruments with the device that is always with them on their wrist (or in their pocket), @HandTuner is a Responsive, Precise Chromatic tuner with a beautiful, intuitive interface that can tune guitar, ukelele, cello, piano, harmonium, bagpipes, harp, violin, your voice, and whatever other instrument you can throw at it!

Reviews:

http://www.androidpolice.com/2015/01/28/athandtuner-wearable-instrument-tuner-wear-watch-works-really-well/

http://www.ubergizmo.com/2015/01/athandtuner-is-a-guitar-tuner-for-your-android-wear-device/

http://www.androidheadlines.com/2015/01/athandtuner-puts-guitar-tuner-android-wear-smartwatch.html

https://disqus.com/home/discussion/androidpolice/athandtuner_is_a_wearable_instrument_tuner_for_your_wear_watch_and_it_works_really_well/

http://phoneia.com/you-can-now-tune-your-guitar-using-android-wear-with-athandtuner/

Once purchased, a chromatic tuner will be installed on your mobile, and an additional smartwatch tuner will be installed on your Android Wear watch (if you have one). You do NOT need a wear device to run the tuner, though, although the current simple and intuitive interface is perfect for wearable devices!

Features:
- 8kHz, 44.1kHz, or f8kHz sample rate
- Wide frequency range
- Precise & Responsive
- Transposition
- Selection of Notation
- Selection of colors
- Synchronization from mobile device to wearable (so you don't have to mess around with the tiny screen on the wearable.)
- "Clip-on" tuner mode, where the screen on the watch can be rotated, and the watch "clipped on" to the guitar."
- 3-Harmonic strobe tuner.
- Two drawing modes: "Arc" and "Trace." Trace mode uses blur effects to show where you've been and where you're going.
- Synchronization to wear device from mobile device.

Works on all of the Wear Devices that we have tested so far, including LG G-Watch, LG G-Watch R, Motorola 360. If you have problems with your own wearable, please let us know!

Limited to devices running 4.0.1 and up because of the integration with Android Wear.

If you have problems, please let us know so we can fix them!

If you want to help us develop features and join our community, join us at atHandTuner Beta on Google+:

https://plus.google.com/u/0/communities/106950377968435927230

And then follow the link from there back to here to opt-into the beta version!

Best Regards, Acorn Technology
comments: This app would be perfect for me if I can manually key in the reference frequencies as I play in a bagpipe band and sometimes need to tune the bass and tebor drums to the frequencies of the bagpipes which ranges between 480 to 495 depending on the weather. Otherwise, this is a fantastic app whenever I need to tune my guitar!
I use this regularly when I'm teaching guitar or gigging. It just needs an auto off as I forget to switch it off sometimes and it completely drains my battery
Great app Beautiful and simple tuner, for both watch and phone.
Works good on both watch and phone.
Works great I use this on my Moto 360. Works as well as my Korg tuner. Using it to tune my violin.
recentChanges: - Added 432Hz to list of reference frequencies.
- Added a small 3-harmonic strobe tuner between note display and cents error display.
- Updated "cents trace" mode for a prettier display, and made it default on new installs.
- Optimized drawing to minimize garbage collection and CPU usage.
